Method Detail

buildLinearDataTable

private static <T,K,V> java.lang.String buildLinearDataTable(java.util.HashMap<K,V> map,
                                                             java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> dates)
toString method that serializes data set as Google Visualization API accepted input.
Example: 
 notation:
 hashmap = { key : value }
 arraylist = [1,2,3, ..., n]
 
 input format: ( request ID -> list of time data )
 { '349' : [123.45, 234.56, 345.67, ...],
   '1001' : [456.78, ...],
   '1002' : [ ... ],
   ... }
 
 output format:
 [ 'x', '349', '1001', '1002', ...],
 [ '' , 123.45, 456.78, ..., ...],
 [ '' , 234.56, ..., ..., ...]

Parameters:
map - test case IDs that links to a list its process time data
Returns:
serialized String data set

buildClusterDataTable

private static Chart buildClusterDataTable(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> containerNames,
                                           java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> urls,
                                           java.util.ArrayList<java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double>> containers,
                                           java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> categories,
                                           java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> descriptions)
toString method that serializes data set as Google Visualization API (bar chart) accepted data input. Example: 
 Notation:
 HashMap = { key : value }
 ArrayList = [1,2,3, ..., n]
 
 Input format:
 containerNames = ['today', 'yesterday', ...]
 urls = { 'url1' : id1, 'url2': id2 }
 containers = {'today' : {'url1':123.45, 'url2':456.78, },
                          'yesteday' : {'url1':123.45, 'url2':456.78, } }
 
 output format:
 [ 'test id', 'today','tooltip1','tooltip2','yesterday','tooltip1','tooltip2', 'diff'],
 [ 1, 3.25, 3.25, 'url1', 3.01, 3.01, 'url2', 0.05],

Parameters:
containerNames - a list of container names
urls - set of urls that maps to their test IDs
containers - meta data structure that holds a list of containers, each container is a pointer to a map of URLs that points to process time
categories - test case URLs that maps to their categories
descriptions - test case URLs that maps to their descriptions
Returns:
chart object

serializeClusterResult

public static Chart serializeClusterResult(java.sql.ResultSet rs)
Serialize result set to a string.
Used for bar chart from Google Visualization API.
Also see helper method Utilities.buildClusterDataTable().

Parameters:
rs - desire result set
Returns:
chart object

serializeLinearResult

public static <T> java.lang.String serializeLinearResult(java.sql.ResultSet rs,
                                                         java.lang.String colName)
                                              throws java.sql.SQLException
Convert query returned result set data to google chart api compatible data structure.
Formatting: A HashMap that each value is a pointer to an ArrayList. Map key is request id, and value is a List of time series data
This is used for "all_test", "cmyk", and "alpha" queries.

Parameters:
rs - desire result set
colName - column name
Returns:
serialized result set as a String
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if result set sql statement cannot be executed

maxRecords

private static <T,K,V> int maxRecords(java.util.HashMap<K,V> map)
Helper function to find the maximum number of records of all given test cases.

Parameters:
map - meta data structure that holds all test cases and their data points
Returns:
max test case number

printData

private static <T,K,V> int printData(java.util.HashMap<K,V> map)
Helper function to print converted data structure.

Parameters:
map - meta data structure that holds all test cases and their values
Returns:
Not in use

renderResultSet

protected static void renderResultSet(java.io.PrintWriter pw,
                                      java.sql.ResultSet result,
                                      java.lang.Boolean editable)
                               throws java.sql.SQLException
Helper function that renders given ResultSet as HTML table to servlet.

Parameters:
pw - caller servlet PrintWriter object
result - desire result set
editable - whether this table will include an "action" button to edit test case metadata current only used in CategoryServlet
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if result set has sql statements that cannot be executed

configToString

public static java.lang.String configToString(java.io.InputStream in)
                                       throws java.io.IOException
Helper function that convert an InputStream object to a String object.
Used for importJSONConfig(), but this method is not currently in use.

Parameters:
in - JSON formatted file InputStream
Returns:
serialized configuration
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if file cannot be read or opened
